      • renameDirectory

        public boolean renameDirectory(java.lang.String aDirectoryPath,
                               java.lang.String aNewDirectoryName)
        Renames directory. If renamed directory already exists an appendix is generated in the form of "_V1", "_V2" etc.
        Parameters:
        aDirectoryPath - Full path of directory
        aNewDirectoryName - New name of directory (WITHOUT path information)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

        Parameters:

        newFileName - New name of file (WITHOUT path information)
        Returns:

      • copyNonExistingSingleFile

        public boolean copyNonExistingSingleFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname,
                                         java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)
        Copies specified file to specified destination if file does NOT exist in specified destination. NOTE: File will not be copied if specified destination pathname already exists. Then true is returned.
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null or empty then false is returned)
        aDestinationFilePathname - Full pathname of destination (may be null or empty then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

                                                 java.lang.String aDirectoryDestinationPath)

        Parameters:
        aDirectorySourcePath - Path of source directory
        aDirectoryDestinationPath - Path of destination directory
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

      • copyPrefixDirectories

        public int copyPrefixDirectories(java.lang.String aDirectorySourcePath,
                                 java.lang.String aPrefix,
                                 java.lang.String aDirectoryDestinationPath)
        Copies all directories that start with specified prefix from source to destination. If a directory with the same name already exists in destination NOTHING is copied.
        Parameters:
        aDirectorySourcePath - Path of source directory
        aPrefix - Prefix of directories to be copied
        aDirectoryDestinationPath - Path of destination directory
        Returns:
        Number of directories copied

                                       java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)

        aSourceFilePathname - Pathname of source file
        aDestinationFilePathname - Pathname of destination file
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

                          java.io.OutputStream anOutputStream,
                          boolean aCloseStreamFlag)

        Parameters:
        anInputStream - Input stream (may be null then false is returned)
        anOutputStream - File output stream (may be null then false is returned)

      • createUniqueDirectoryWithDateTimeEnding

        public DirectoryInformation createUniqueDirectoryWithDateTimeEnding(java.lang.String aDirectoryDestinationPath,
                                                                    java.lang.String aDirectoryPrefix)
        Creates a unique directory in destination path with specified date-time-ending. NOTE: This method should NOT be called from parallelised threads due to passed timestamp and small time difference between check of already existing directory and creation of directory.
        Parameters:
        aDirectoryDestinationPath - Destination path for unique directory to be created in
        aDirectoryPrefix - Prefix for unique directory name (ending is date-time string)
        Returns:
        Directory information or null if unique directory could not be created

        Returns full pathname of new unique temporary directory. NOTE: New unique temporary directory is NOT created!
        Returns:
        Full pathname of new unique temporary directory

        Parameters:
        aZipFilePathname - Full path and name of ZIP file (must exist, otherwise false is returned)
        Returns:
        Directory name from ZIP file or null

      • getSingleFileFromZipFile

        public boolean getSingleFileFromZipFile(java.lang.String aZipFilePathname,
                                        java.lang.String aSingleFilename,
                                        java.lang.String aDestinationPathname)
        Returns (first occurrence of) single file from ZIP file that was created with Utility.copyDirectoryToZipFile()
        Parameters:
        aZipFilePathname - Full path and name of ZIP file (must exist, otherwise false is returned)
        aSingleFilename - File name (without path) of single file
        aDestinationPathname - Full path and name for destination of the single file (not allowed to already exist: If file already exists false is returned)
        Returns:
        True: Operation was successful, false: Otherwise

      • getSingleDirectoryFromZipFile

        public boolean getSingleDirectoryFromZipFile(java.lang.String aZipFilePathname,
                                             java.lang.String aDirectoryPrefix,
                                             java.lang.String aDestinationPath)
        Returns single directory with specified prefix from ZIP file that was created with Utility.copyDirectoryToZipFile(). NOTE: The directory prefix must be unique in all file pathnames of ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        aZipFilePathname - Full path and name of ZIP file (must exist, otherwise false is returned)
        aDirectoryPrefix - name (without path) of single file
        aDestinationPath - Full path for destination of single directory (not allowed to already exist: If directory already exists false is returned)
        Returns:
        True: Operation was successful, false: Otherwise

      • getSingleDirectoryNameFromZipFile

        public java.lang.String getSingleDirectoryNameFromZipFile(java.lang.String aZipFilePathname,
                                                          java.lang.String aDirectoryPrefix)
        Returns single directory name with specified prefix from ZIP file that was created with Utility.copyDirectoryToZipFile(). NOTE: The directory prefix must be unique in all file pathnames of ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        aZipFilePathname - Full path and name of ZIP file (must exist, otherwise false is returned)
        aDirectoryPrefix - name (without path) of single file
        Returns:
        Full directory name that corresponds to specified prefix or null if prefix could not be found

      • copyDirectoryToZipFile

        public boolean copyDirectoryToZipFile(java.lang.String aDirectoryPath,
                                      java.lang.String aZipFilePathname)
        Copies directory to ZIP file
        Parameters:
        aDirectoryPath - Full path of directory (must exist, otherwise false is returned)
        aZipFilePathname - Full path and name of ZIP file (is NOT allowed to already exist, otherwise false is returned)
        Returns:
        True: Operation was successful, false: Otherwise

        public java.lang.String[] readStringArrayFromFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname,
                                                  java.lang.String aCommentLinePrefix)
        Reads string array from file
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null/empty then null is returned)
        aCommentLinePrefix - Prefix of comment line (may be null/empty)
        Returns:
        String array or null if string array could not be read

      • readStringArrayPartFromFile

        public java.lang.String[] readStringArrayPartFromFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname,
                                                      java.lang.String aCommentLinePrefix,
                                                      java.lang.String aSectionTag)
        Reads string array from specified section of file
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null then null is returned)
        aCommentLinePrefix - Prefix of comment line to ignore (may be null/empty)
        aSectionTag - Section tag (if null/empty then null is returned)
        Returns:
        String array from specified section of file or null if string array could not be read

      • readDefinedStringArrayFromFile

        public java.lang.String[] readDefinedStringArrayFromFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname)
        Reads string array from file. NOTE: First line must be size of string array.
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null then null is returned)
        Returns:
        String array or null if string array could not be read

      • writeStringArrayToFile

        public boolean writeStringArrayToFile(java.lang.String[] aStringArray,
                                      java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)
        Writes string array to file. NOTE: If destination pathname already exists nothing is done.
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (may be null then false is returned)
        aDestinationFilePathname - Full pathname of destination (may be null then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

      • writeDefinedStringArrayToFile

        public boolean writeDefinedStringArrayToFile(java.lang.String[] aStringArray,
                                             java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)
        Writes string array to file. First line is the number of lines. NOTE: If destination pathname already exists nothing is done.
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (may be null then false is returned)
        aDestinationFilePathname - Full pathname of destination (may be null then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

      • readJaggedStringArrayFromFile

        public java.lang.String[][] readJaggedStringArrayFromFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname,
                                                          java.lang.String aCommentLinePrefix)
        Reads jagged string array from file. Each line is splitted after one or more whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null then null is returned)
        aCommentLinePrefix - Prefix of comment line (may be null/empty)
        Returns:
        Jagged string array or null if jagged string array could not be read

      • readJaggedStringArrayPartFromFile

        public java.lang.String[][] readJaggedStringArrayPartFromFile(java.lang.String aSourceFilePathname,
                                                              java.lang.String aCommentLinePrefix,
                                                              java.lang.String aSectionTag)
        Reads jagged string array from specified section of file. Each line is splitted after one or more whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        aSourceFilePathname - Full pathname of source (may be null then null is returned)
        aCommentLinePrefix - Prefix of comment line to ignore (may be null/empty)
        aSectionTag - Section tag (if null/empty then null is returned)
        Returns:
        Jagged string array from specified section of file or null if jagged string array could not be read

                                                  java.lang.String aResourceName)

        Parameters:
        aClass - A class with a resource relative to it (may be null then null is returned)
        aResourceName - Resource name relative to class (may be null or empty then null is returned)
        Returns:
        Resource input stream or null if none were found

                                         java.lang.String aResourceName,
                                         java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)
        Copies resource to destination if destination does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        aClass - A class with a resource relative to it (may be null then false is returned)
        aResourceName - Resource name relative to class (may be null or empty then false is returned)
        aDestinationFilePathname - Pathname for destination (may be null or empty then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

      • hasResource

        public boolean hasResource(java.lang.Class<?> aClass,
                           java.lang.String aResourceName)
        Checks if defined resource exists
        Parameters:
        aClass - A class with a resource relative to it (may be null then false is returned)
        aResourceName - Resource name relative to class (may be null or empty then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Resource exists, false: Otherwise

      • copyEncryptedResourceToDestination

        public boolean copyEncryptedResourceToDestination(java.lang.Class<?> aClass,
                                                  java.lang.String aResourceName,
                                                  java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname,
                                                  byte[] aKeyByteArray)
        Copies encrypted resource to destination if destination does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        aClass - A class with a resource relative to it (may be null then false is returned)

        aDestinationFilePathname - Pathname for destination (may be null or empty then false is returned)

        public java.lang.String getFilenameWithoutExtension(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Returns filename without extension, e.g. "Test.txt" returns "Test"
        Parameters:
        aFilename - Filename with extension
        Returns:
        Filename without extension or aFilename if aFilename does not have an extension

      • getExtensionOfFilename

        public java.lang.String getExtensionOfFilename(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Returns extension of filename, e.g. "Test.txt" returns ".txt"
        Parameters:
        aFilename - Filename with extension
        Returns:
        Extension of filename or null/empty string if filename does not have an extension (if filename was null then null is returned, if filename was empty than empty string is returned)

      • getIncrementedFilename

        public java.lang.String getIncrementedFilename(java.lang.String aFilename,
                                               int anIncrement)
        Returns incremented filename, e.g. filename = "Test.txt" and anIncrement = 3 returns "Test_3.txt"
        Parameters:
        aFilename - File name
        anIncrement - Increment
        Returns:
        Incremented filename or null if none could be created

        Parameters:

        Returns:
